description:
Miyanaga Saki is a first year high school girl whose family would get angry if she won the family mahjong games. But losing would also have its consequences. Because of this she develops a new way of playing that allows her to stay on the thin line between winning and losing, the plus/minus zero score, an almost impossible score. In a game that relies mainly on luck, the plus/minus zero score is harder than winning, but Saki can achieve this every time.

Having always hated the game, her friend from middle school, Suga Kyotoro, forces her to play in the schools mahjong club. Her developed skill and superhuman luck has made her a worthy mahjong opponent, even to the middle school's national mahjong champion.

(Source: Anime News Network, edited)

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.description: Centers around characters playing board games.

[Profile (Ken Production)](https://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/8) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/beerlover-shizuka/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shizuka_Itō) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤静)

She married on December 5, 2012, her 32nd birthday, but later announced her divorce on April 30, 2020.

She was part of the seiyuu unit with [Hitomi Nabatame](https://anilist.co/staff/95184/) called "Hitomi Nabatame to Shizuka Itou" (生天目仁美と伊藤静) under Geneon's cosmic★motion label. Together they are known by the name Hitoshizuku (ひとしずく).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/setoken) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/瀬藤健嗣)

Started of with photography work, soon switched to directing.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/setoken) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/瀬藤健嗣)

Started of with photography work, soon switched to directing.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135960980) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoshimichi_kameda)

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).
